source: WHO Disease Outbreak News - Malawi Cholera 2023
processing_notes: Source states: '59,334 cumulative cases' and '1,774 deaths' with 'CFR 3.0%' - interpreted as sCh cases. Deadliest outbreak in Malawi's history affecting all 29 districts.

source: WHO Disease Outbreak News - Malawi Cholera 2023
processing_notes: Source states: '36,943 cases including 1,210 deaths' with 'overall case fatality rate (CFR) of 3.3%' - interpreted as sCh cases for specific reporting period.
Source states: '33 546 cases and 968 deaths (CFR 3%)' for 2001/02 outbreak - interpreted as sCh cases. Affected 26 of 29 districts.

Source states: 'Machinga district has reported 2,303 cases and 86 deaths' - interpreted as sCh cases for outbreak origin district.

Source states: 'Karonga district reported 790 cases and 16 deaths as of November 2022' - interpreted as sCh cases for Northern Region district.
Source states: 'Salima (3,570 cases and 99 deaths)' - interpreted as sCh cases for Central Region lake district.

Source states: 'a total of 693 cases with 11 deaths were registered in 8 districts representing a case fatality rate of 1.6%' - interpreted as sCh cases for cross-border outbreak from Mozambique.
Source states: '1,795 cases of cholera with 48 deaths' representing 'CFR of 2.7%' - interpreted as sCh cases for extended outbreak affecting 14 districts.

Source states: 'In Zomba District, the outbreak started in December 2009 and lasted until the end of April 2010, with 324 cases reported and one death (CFR 0.3%)' - interpreted as sCh cases for Lake Chilwa district.

Source states: 'Nsanje district had reported 76 cases and four deaths from cholera, making it the most severely affected district early in the outbreak' - interpreted as sCh cases for cross-border Shire River transmission.

Source states: 'In Phalombe District, the outbreak started towards the end of December 2009 and lasted until the middle of March 2010, with 176 cases reported, with three deaths (CFR 1.7%)' - interpreted as sCh cases.
Source states: 'Thyolo Registers Six Cholera Cases' in two Traditional Authorities - interpreted as sCh cases for recent surveillance period.
Source states: 'Dedza district has reported 2,053 cases and 79 deaths as of March 29, 2023' - interpreted as sCh cases for lake district in Central Region.
Source states: 'The case fatality rate (CFR) for Kasungu district was 6.67% (6 deaths out of 90 cases), which was among the highest in the country' - interpreted as sCh cases.

Source states: 'Balaka (4278 cases and 102 deaths)' - interpreted as sCh cases for significantly affected district with vaccination campaigns.

Source states: 'Malawi is recording sporadic cholera cases in selected areas of Chikwawa, Mangochi and Zomba, especially in Cyclone Freddy affected areas with less than five patients a day' - interpreted as ongoing surveillance in Shire Valley.
Source states: 'Ntcheu registers one cholera case' - interpreted as sCh cases for recent surveillance period in Central Region.

Source states: 'Neno district was declared cholera-free in May 2023 after experiencing a significant outbreak that began on April 29, 2022, and infected 783 people with 10 deaths' - interpreted as sCh cases for complete outbreak period.
Source states: 'cholera was first reported in 1973 and has been endemic since 1998' - validated absence period of 24 years before endemic establishment with sporadic transmission only.
Source states: gap between major outbreaks with 'areas relatively unaffected by cholera for more than a decade' - validated absence period between 2008-2009 and 2022 outbreaks.
Source states: 'zero reports of cholera in Malawi for more than four weeks' following GTFCC guidelines - validated absence via WHO official surveillance confirmation.

Source states: 'cholera outbreak in the lake districts of Malawi has killed one person out of 51 reported cases' with 'first 10 cases were reported last week in the resort district of Mangochi' - interpreted as sCh cases affecting fishing communities around Lake Malawi.

Source states: '2011/2012 cholera outbreak was widespread in the southern region, affecting 10 out of 13 districts, where 1,806 cases and 38 deaths (CFR 2.1%) were reported' - interpreted as sCh cases for Southern Region outbreak.
